alert.note: Alert for Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:18PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Ocean and south central Monmouth Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jacksons Mills, or 10 miles northwest of Toms River, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lakewood, Howell, Freewood Acres, Ramtown, Vista Center and Allenwood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 23 and 31. Garden State Parkway near mile marker 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
